Articles.Content:
So there's this older mod called Duna Direct linked here:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93809-0-24-2-DunaDirect-Sabatier-Reactor

and I'm having issues with it in RSS with real fuels. Does anyone know how to make it work with Methane Oxygen and Hydrogen? Thanks!!!

I can't offer you any premade solutions, but if you want to do it yourself, you would have to replace the resource names in the mars direct mod's config files (its for stock as far as I saw) with the ones from realfuels. Pay attention to proper mass ratios, you might have to do a little math if you want to get that correctly.

If you want to do something more complex, take a look at regolith, that should allow you to add resources like CO2 to atmospheres and then write custom scoops for it.
I tried annually editing it like that, but It didn't work.

I tried annually editing it like that, but It didn't work.

Can you post your cfg you tryed or what you want to replace what with what ?

Universal Storage has an excellent Sabatier part if that is what you're looking for. It uses Oxygen and Hydrogen by default and I'm sure you can modify it to also use Methane. If you're set on using the (ugly IMO) Duna Direct parts it might help to look at the Universal Storage Sabatier configs to see what the conversion rates are etc. There might also be a realfuels config for Universal Storage, but I haven't actually checked.
